alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 2:02AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southeastern Santa Barbara County. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 159 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain moving across southern Santa Barbara County. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Rainfall rates between 0.33 and 0.66 inch per hour are expected to occur. Local rainfall rate around 0.75 inch per hour are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Barbara, Goleta, Montecito, Carpinteria, Summerland, Mission Canyon, and Highway 154 over San Marcos Pass. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
